user_review: It will probably seem like I'm gushing about this eating experience, but that's because I am. Since it was one of the more memorable meals I've had in quite some time. Let's face it, take-out may be convenient, but it's no replacement for superb service or a beginning to end meal that makes you feel like a VIP. On that note, I want to mention Luc was a highlight of the evening and oversaw that every detail was attended to. To the point where it even surprised me. He is experienced and polished (but not in the stuffy way).Perhaps, what made this meal even more memorable was for its simplicity. It was virtually bread, a main, wine and an after dinner sip. To be more specific the bread was an incredibly fresh, warm and fluffy focaccia with traditional olive oil and balsamic vinegar for dipping purposes.The main, the focal point of the meal, was a daily special of trout with crispy skin (they should trademark this method) stacked on top of a saffron risotto base; with al dente vegetables like zuchinni and eggplant. To sum up the most delectable of plates - it was a trifecta of excellence: taste, quality and value. Usually, a stack is just a fancy way of plating, but in this case it somehow enhanced the dish. Otherwise, it was just so darn tasty, I'm making more of a big deal of the plating, to make sure the exemplary nature of the dish comes through in this review. Finally, a well paired wine and an after dinner sip to round things off.Perhaps, it would have been easier to simply say the meal was an all around five or better yet, I would like to eat there everyday; if I could.

We arrive at Jacopo for Happening Gourmand event. This is my second visit to Jacopo; previously, I enjoyed a delicious and beautiful brunch. Tonight, Let's say it was a memorable evening. Outside, we were freezing, but the luminous decors outside give you a slight warmth in your heart, then in the restaurant, full of people, the vibrancy is all over. Then our waiter Benjamin is the most friendly, animated person I have encountered. Initially, I wasn't sure he was annoying or clever, but honestly we fell in love with him. He is very knowledgeable  about everything, and you can get into an easy conversation about any topics. He is so infectious, the couple beside us became part of our conversation. For happening gourmand, we had the table d'hôte menu. I had a honey old fashioned cocktail (A+, excellent) followed by a cauliflower salad (A+, perfectly flavored), then squash risotto with blue cheese (A-, creamy but little bitter) and apple pie with caramel and ice cream (C, too sweet). All this 29$ plus 10$ for the cocktail. Perfect deal! The restaurant itself is beautiful but the meat rack in the glass window is slightly disturbing. Service, food, and ambiance are excellent. Recommended!!!

Came here for happening gourmand during brunch time. I tried the italian eggs benedict and a donut duo with custard. The donuts were delicious. They were warm and covered  with caramel with a chocolate middle. The custard was very creamy. The eggs benedict were ok. The portion was pretty small and it was kind of dry. The service was great and the inside is nicely decorated.

This Old Port elegant yet not pretencious place was excellent! With the dim lights and modern, cozy vibes, it's perfect for a date night.The service was great, the staff is really friendly and warm. They are really knowledgeable and patient, our waiter really took the time to explain us the dishes, give recommendations and helped us pick the right wine for the meal, which we loved.The food was also amazing, we got the tuna carpaccio, which was really tasty, the osso buco and the tiramisu for dessert.The carpaccio was delicious, really well seasoned, and the osso buco would just melt in your mouth. The pole ta that comes in the osso buco was one of the best I've ever had! They have a different take on this osso buco, the sauce sort of reminded me of "parmeggiana". Different from others I've had, but really delicious! The tiramisu was also amazing, very light and not too sweet.Definitely recommend!
Their burrata is my favourite! And their bread is really good. I ordered gnocchi and it was pretty good. Our server was super helpful and nice!

Prices are very standard for Old Montreal bit I'm happy to report the food is absolutely delicious.The mortadella is delicious and perfectly slices thin..the burrata is amazingly simple and perfect.  Extra creamy and just lovely...only wish it wasn't served so chilled..but I'm guessing it needs to be?Anyways the service is top notch and the location could be more in the heart of things.

This is a fairly new restaurant that opened a little over 3 weeks ago in the main heart of Old Montreal, the Place Jaques Cartier Square! Closeby  Maggie Oakes. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable of the menu to give suggestions. I loved the outdoor terrace that truly captures Montreal's heart and soul. Sip on some wine and dine while you see and hear street performers in the square.For the menu, we opted to try a couple of items. For 22$ you can pick from a variety of cheese and charcuterie, Add 3$+ and try their truffle honey (highly recommended). I thought for the price and considering the location of the restaurant, you get a good bargain for your food. (If it weren't Old Montreal, they could be a bit more generous with the cheese portions). For the main course: we tried two of the handmade pastas-the squid ink seafood pasta (3/5) and the squash stuffed ravioli (5/5). The first I found a tad salty, I really enjoyed the ravioli. The prices for the items are reasonable as well, around the 15-18$ range. Dishes are good to share. The cocktails are also good.Overall, a lovely space- I think I found my go to of Old Montreal. Second to Perche as my favorite rooftop in the area of course!

Last weekend I went to Jacopo to try out their Happening Gourmand brunch. We all ordered their bomboloni (Italian donut). It was delicious, fluffy and drizzled with caramel. Most of us took the Italian Benedict - the prosciutto was so crispy! I have never had it like that and was pleasantly surprised. Everything was so tasty. The potatoes literally melted in your mouth. The only thing that I was disappointed with was their latte. Don't get me wrong it was good but I was expecting it to be bigger. It came in a regular coffee sized  cup. I've always had my lattes in big cups. I finished it halfway through my brunch.

Feb 15, 2020I received a promotion from American Express for a special valentine dinner at Jacopo for $250 taxes and tip included.  So I tried it.It's a nice restaurant in a very touristy part of Old Montreal, Place Jacques Cartier.  However, we went in Feb when there are very few tourists.  Like everything in Old Montreal, parking is an issue but I think Jacopo has valet parking.  I found parking nearby, illegally, cause it was a for permit only, so I didn't use the velvet service.The service was excellent. Our waitress, Marilou, was excellent.  Very friendly and had great recommendations.  She was very friendly and very considerate.  We didn't feel rushed at all.The following is the meal we had for 2 people:AntipastiMerluzzo carpaccio1. Smoked black cod carpaccio, roasted red pepper, marinated eggplant, lemon & honey2.Artichoke stuffed with sausage, rapini & taleggioSecondi Vitelli e polpoTo share Grilled octopus and grilled veal chop with sautéed mushrooms and truffle mashed potatoesDolciPanacotta con vino rossoRed wine panna cotta with candied baconWe started the meal with a really good Prosecco included in the package.  It wasn't part of the regular Jacopo Valentine menu.  All the other food was.  The food was excellent.  The portions were a little on the small side.  We added an order of fried calamari and had had 1 glass of red wine.  This added about $65 ( tax and tip included) to the all included $250.  At the end of the meal, we were give a really nice bouquet of flowers.  All in all, this was a really nice evening. The food was really good.  The artichoke was hard to eat but the stuffing was really good.  The cod carpaccio was very good.  The second part was extremely flavourable.  The veal chop was cooked to perfection.  The octopus was delicious.  The mash potatoes were just so tasty, it's crazy.  Lastly, the dessert was good but seemed a little overshadowed by the rest of the meal.For $315, the price is a little high.  The portions are on the small side but the quality is absolutely there. But, the price is a sore spot.  Too bad because it's really a good meal.  For the same price, I've been to other excellent restaurants that offer more at the same quality or more.

Had lunch on the outside deck of Jacopo and it was absolutely wonderful. The service and food were both great. We got the pre-fix lunch menu which was an amazing deal for only $22. We both got the salad starter which was delicious. For our main lunch my boyfriend got the Orecchiette with sausage and I got Gnocchi. They were both super yummy. For dessert the pre-fix meal comes with biscotti with chocolate chips and marshmallows. I told them I had a nut allergy and they provided a separate dessert which was Panna cotta. Absolutely so good and such great attention to those will allergies.Would definitely come back!

My husband and I ate here for dinner twice during our annual trip to Montreal this year, and we were pleasantly surprised with this new restaurant! Between our two visits, we ordered the charcuterie board (adding-on the truffle honey is HIGHLY recommended!), Cacio e Pepe, Spaghetti Carbonara (pictured), Orecchiette con Rapini e Salsiccia (pictured), Risotto ai funghi (pictured), and Tiramisu (pictured). Every dish was well-seasoned and perfectly prepared, though our favorites hands-down were the Spaghetti Carbonara and Orecchiette con Rapini e Salsiccia. The food service was a little slow, but the servers were friendly and the food was definitely worth the wait!

The waiter and bartender were so attentive and treated us (and I noticed they treat other guests too) like VIPs.  The restaurant decor is pretty romantic too. Perfect place for a date night. It has Old Montreal charm yet modern and stylish. We had few pretty good appetizers and I highly recommend the delicious Ravioli di Zucca for main course for guests who feel like having vegetarian meal. You know the saying: "People may not remember exactly what you did, or what you said, but they will always remember how you made them feel." In my case, I don't remember exactly what I ate at Jacopo aside from the Ravioli main course, but I will always remember the WOW experience I had after leaving the restaurant.  5 Stars!

Out from work for lunch, the experience was quite pleasant and restful.While most patrons were outside enjoying themselves with their life experiences and tumultuous existence, I was escorted to the bar, alone and on my own... superb seating arrangement for a loner who was looking for a good meal and peace of mind.A special thank you for the young lady hostess and male waiter who knew to let me be, yet attend to my stay quietly.The fish meal was very good to the eyes, nose and mouth... and wallet.If only I could find such moments more often.

I had a reservation here, and requested to sit outside but that would have been 20 more minutes.  Oh well, we got inside and it was beautiful and not too loud.  We ordered the cacio e pepe and gnocchi.  We thought the gnocchi came with burrata, but it did not.  It would have been $18 more.  Despite the small disappointments we had a wonderful meal and the staff were excellent.

We stumbled on Jacopo trying to get out of the cold one evening late Jan.  I'll be back.  We only had appetizers which were all fantastic; Bruschetta, burrata, braised artichoke hearts.  Yum.  The bartenders were friendly and the drinks creative.  Loved the whole vibe of the place!

We rolled in with 11 people for a bachelorette party and they were SO accommodating. Meghan was an absolute dream and gave us suggestions on not only drinks but also places to go while we're in town and even helped us get on a guest list for a club by us! We stayed for a good hour or two and never felt rushed or pressured in any way at all.Besides the (amazing) service, the cocktails were delicious as was the rose sangria. If you're strolling old town and would like a place to grab a drink outside, this is a great spot.

Absolutely great experience. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff which made us feel "at home". Hands down the best home made pasta (authentic Italian) I had in Canada so far. Some North Americans might not like it, due to their pasta being served al dente

Pretty much your typical old port restaurant with an outdoor terrace, perfect for the summer! Service was average, food was good but the portions are not filling, and the price was okay. Not the most authentic Italian restaurant, but definitely traditional with a modern ambience. There are other items on the menu I would want to try so I would still come back, but for lunch most likely because that seems more worth it. 3.5/5 star!

I was really excited to try this place unfortunately I feel like it fell short for the standards of great Italian food we have in Montreal. We started with the happy hour spritz pitcher for 35$ and a choice charcuterie plate. The charcuterie was pretty basic, nothing out of the ordinary. The spritz pitcher was good except every time the waiter poured me a glass I just got more and more ice with very little spritz. I got the bruschetta because it's August in Quebec and tomato season is upon us! The tomatoes were not ripe (white tomatoes should be a crime) and tasted like the Fontaine Santé premade one you can get at the grocery store. What a let down! I had the pasta with speck in a light cream sauce. It was good. Basic. Passable. My husband has the orrechietti with sausage and rapini. It was tasty and spicy although I found the rapini too bitter (while rapini is always bitter I've had better). The service was good, the restaurant itself is beautiful (although I could do without the fake wood oven and charcuterie fridge) and they seem to accommodate groups well. It's unfortunate that this is another tourist place that reminded me of why I generally stay away from old Montreal.
Very nice restaurant with great outdoor seating The food was good, my pork was a bit overdone A bit high on the prices but it might of been due to the Grand Prix.

Excellent Italian food, including fresh pasta, very fine wine list, very fine full bar, and very comfortable and courteous service.  If ever in Montréal again, would definitely return to this fine Italian restaurant.

Surprising gem in Old Montreal.  My mom and I were staying at a nearby hotel and were looking for dinner after we arrived.  The concierge at our hotel recommended this place and after trying Jacopo, we trusted him with all other recommendations.  The restaurant is clean, beautiful, with a classy atmosphere that isn't too stuffy.  The servers were very pleasant, and the food was delicious! Although simple, it was the best bruschetta I've ever had and the pasta was phenomenal.

Everything for our meal was pretty tasty for such a touristy area. The gnocchi with burrata was really good, as well as the grilled calamari. Only downgrade would be the entertainment outside (no fault of the restaurant), which was very distracting, so maybe sit inside if they're performing.
Very good experience. Tasty food and good service. I recommend to order and share starters, maybe one pasta dish for the main course is enough. Prices are at the higher level just ok for the location

Visiting Montreal from the states and the old Montreal area can seem pretty touristy. This place on the other hand was fantastic. Food was amazing and the atmosphere was even better. Our server Benjamin was the best and made our night.

This restaurant is particularly great when they have their pitchers of different spritz drinks - my friend and I sat and enjoyed a delicious meal and drinks and enjoyed the beautiful summer weather! Everyone was friendly and we didn't feel rushed at all. A really great way to start our trip in Montreal!
Ate here on June 5, 2019.  This place was great from start to finish.  The staff was extremely nice and the food was amazing!
Had a Bachelorette dinner here and it was A M A Z I N G. Out server BENJAMIN was above and beyond!!

Buyer Beware: Food is good,  but they tried to over charge us for drinks.  We were told by multiple staff members that the happy hour was from 3-7pm and that aperol Spritz were $5 a glass... but then we were charged $12 each.  There must have been a misunderstanding, but it didn't make for a nice experience...

This place was within walking distance to our airbnb in Old Montreal and was totally worth the 2 minute walk. On a Monday night around 6pm we got a seat outside right away and had good service. I got the spaghetti carbonara which was aldente, the way pasta should be. Would reccomend!!
Great ambiance! We just touched down from Texas and wanted something light and delicious. I had the gnocchi and bruschetta. It was delicious and light.

Incredible experience at Jacopo.  We were tired, hot and weary and our stop off at Jacopo changed our day.  Our server Meghan was very friendly, attentive and knowledgeable and really went out of her way to make it a special experience for us.The restaurant has only been open for 3 months and yet, they were on their game - no kinks here.  I recommend the squash ravioli which was certainly the best dish we had on our entire trip to Quebec.  If you are in Montreal, make this one of your stops.

My daughter and I wandered in based on the menu and location. As others have stated, the bruschetta was simply amazing! We had the arancini (although I forget what it was called on this menu!) It was superb! We shared the gnocchi as or main dish and not a bite was left! We were much too full for dessert--luckily we have a few days in town and are likely to venture back!
Very good cheese and charcuterie. Brandon had some very insightful suggestions regarding wine pairings! Would recommend for a causal meal

Great location, good service.  The Finocchio salad was terrific!  I would go back for just the salad.  Enjoyed the  Spaghetti Carbonara, and I ordered a lemonade which was terrific.  I would definitely come here again.
Good pasta with original spritzer selection.  Very friendly staff and nice outdoor seating.
Brandon was great with the wine pairing with the cheeses, was super friendly and answered all our questions about the menu. Great experience, definitely would recommend
Really bland food and slow service. We're still sitting here 15 minutes later waiting for the check. Had to pull my phone out and let it out.

We came here for my boyfriend's 30th birthday and had the absolute best dinner. Our server, Brian, was incredibly friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable. Although it was quite busy he constantly checked in with us and he knew so much about the wine list. I ordered the pappardelle and my boyfriend ordered the gnocchi - both were amazing, and the pappardelle was some of the best fresh made pasta I have ever had. The atmosphere of the restaurant itself is beautiful and the meal was so special :) We will definitely be coming back next time we are in Montreal again!
Great food and even better service. Our waiter's name was Nick and he was great. Truly made our experience what it was. I had the cacio pepe pasta and I promise it did not disappoint.
It is a very nice place to have a summer dinner with a beautiful view on an outdoor terrace. Food was delicious and very well cooked and cocktails were just perfect! Highly recommend

Amazing restaurant - I highly recommend. Great atmosphere, top notch service and authentic Italian food. If you are in Old Montreal, this restaurant is a must. Whether you are sitting inside in the trendy dining room, or outside on the patio with a view, you will be so happy you dined here. I cannot wait to come back!
